intro: Coccoloba hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is a shrub or small tree native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with hairy surfaces, which give it its common name. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Coccoloba hirsuta is often found in moist, tropical environments and is valued for its ornamental foliage.
